brief_summary.textblock:
The purpose of this study is to evaluate efficacy of tyrosine as a treatment for
      methamphetamine dependence in an outpatient treatment setting providing group psychosocial
      interventions.  Examine effect of tyrosine on abstinence, retention in treatment, and
      craving."

detailed_description.textblock:
Evaluate efficacy of tyrosine as a treatment for methamphetamine dependence in an outpatient
      treatment setting providing group psychosocial interventions.  Examine effect of tyrosine on
      abstinence, retention in treatment and craving.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

        18-65 years of age. Able to provide informed consent. Desire to reduce/eliminate
        methamphetamine use.  Used within the past two weeks.  Meet DSM criteria for
        methamphetamine dependence.

        Exclusion Criteria:

        No dependence (within the past 12 months) for other durgs except nicotine. No history or
        family history of tyrosine intolerance.

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Masking: Double-Blind, Primary Purpose: Treatment
